intro: Michelia glaucophylla, commonly known as the white-leafed michelia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Monimiaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of southern China, particularly in Yunnan and Sichuan provinces. The plant is characterized by its broad, glaucous (bluish-gray) leaves and fragrant white flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in subtropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
